channel.title: City on Every Corner of Korea

item.title: Tour of Jeju's 4th and 3rd historic sites that left in brilliant spring - Jeju City, Jeju, Korea
item.description:
Jeju 4.3 Peace Park where the victims of the Jeju 4/3 incident fell asleep

Tour of Jeju's 4th and 3rd historic sites that left in brilliant spring

Jeju City, Jeju, Korea

In spring, bright April, this time of year, the island gets wet with silent pain. This is because it has a sad history hidden behind a bright pile of flowers, and Jeju 4/3 incidents. This year, the Jeju 4th and 3rd event celebrated its 71st anniversary. One day when it rained, I followed the flying petals and searched for traces of the time. Even in the field where rape blossoms are scattered, and in the white waves of the sea, there are still unscathed wounds wherever the petals touch.
Jeju 4/3 Peace Park, where you learn and know Jeju 4/3
I don't know if there are people who remember. It's an old old drama story. The drama <The Eye of the Dawn> that I watched while I was young. One of the scenes I still remember is the burning of thatched houses and soldiers dragging people randomly. At that time, I didn't know that it was Jeju Island. I didn't even know if the scene showed Jeju 4/3 event (Jeju 4/3).
Before I left the road, I remembered the moment. If there is something that has not changed as a child or now, I still do not know the history of Jeju 4/3. As the first course, I visited Jeju 4/3 Peace Park. Bonggae-dong hillside where Hallasan was cast like a shadow in the distance, and the Jeju 4/3 Peace Park is a space to remember the Jeju 4/3 and remember the victims. There are several facilities on the grounds, such as the 4.3 Peace Memorial Hall, the Memorial Hall, each monument, and the Wipeongbongso. On the 3rd of April every year, the “Jeju 4/3 victims' memorial service” is held here.
A space to remember the Jeju 4/3 incident and commemorate the victim
When we entered the 4th and 3rd Peace Memorial Hall, Baekbi (a monument without inscription) met us silently. A pure stone monument with nothing written on it. In front of the lying Baekbi, there is a slab with the phrase, “One day, I will engrave the name of Jeju 4 · 3 and raise it up”. As I quietly woke up alone, I feel like one of my breasts is getting eaten.
Baekbi in the shape of the Jeju 4/3 incident
After passing by Baekbi, the story of Jeju Island, which has been in pain for many years, can be heard. Each exhibition hall divided into several themes describes in detail the background, cause, and process of Jeju 4/3. Many people who have died without knowing English because of the vortex of ideology after liberation, and the heartbreaking history that has been forced into silence for many years, are still alive and breathing here. Many people do not know yet, so the history is sadder. Jeju 4 · 3 is like a puzzle piece lost in modern Korean history.
Refuge of people who escaped to the winter mountains to avoid the subjugation
The exhibition hall arranged Jeju 4 and 3 events over the years from April 3, 1948 to 1954, which lifted the Hallasan Geumjoryeong Order in chronological order. Thanks to this, it is easy to understand even those who are new to Jeju 4 · 3 history. During this period, more than 30,000 Jeju Islanders were reportedly lost and missing. The exhibition tells the stories of the villages in the middle-mountainous area that have been burned down, and the people who have lost their lives have to hide into the mountains and caves.
The Jeju 4 · 3 case materials are exhibited in full.
Exit the memorial hall and breathe in the fresh air to catch the heavy heart. Inside the park, where spring greens are swelling, it is very calm and calm to match the word “peace”. After a moment of meditation, I stepped toward the hill and soon reached the tower. Each monument surrounds the tower of Yuryong that stretches out into a clear sky.
The monuments that continued endlessly around the memorial tower
The name, gender, age, and date of death of the victims of each village are engraved on each monument. More than 20,000 names written here. Those who have passed down countless times on top of the monuments that endlessly endlessly overlap, and sad grief comes again.
Some of the victims are babies and girls who are only four years old.
At the top of the park, there is a wispy peak ensemble built to comfort the victims' souls and a missing sign. There are about 14,000 victims enshrined in the Vietongbongansil, and can be commemorated from 9 am to 6 pm. I was thinking about preparing a chrysanthemum for Hwahwa.
Viebongbong Restroom with 14,000 victims
Many victims of Jeju 4 · 3 were missing or could not find their bodies. This is because most of those arrested in Jeju Island on April 3 and sent to prison on land were shot and buried during the Korean War. How many have died and have not been able to lie down comfortably. As I watched the thousands of milestones that colored the green grassland black, tears flowed without my knowledge.
A missing stone with about 3890 aircraft installed in a wide field.
Bukchon Nerve Monkey 4/3 Memorial Hall
Bukchon-ri, a small seaside town, is a 30-minute drive from Jeju 4/3 Peace Park. When I visited this village, the old cedar tree standing at the mouth of the village was very impressive.
Bukchon 4th and 3rd Memorial Hall
Bukchon Village, where the whole town is celebrated every night on New Year's Eve every year, has the pain of over 350 residents being shot by soldiers on the same day. Bukchon's 4th and 3rd Memorial Hall records the details of the day. The tearful testimonies of the survivors still look back at the wounds of those who have not healed.
Visitors are watching videos related to Jeju 4 and 3 events

Outside the memorial hall, the pains of the past are still standing. Stone graves of young children remain in the place where the shooting occurred, and literary monuments and monuments of “Uncle Soon-I”, which depicts the bodies being scattered, lay all over the place.

Tomb of little children left in the form of a pile
'Uncle Soon-I' by Jeju novelist Hyun Ki-young is based on the case of Bukchon-ri. Through this, Jeju 4/3, which was taboo, became known to the world little by little.
There is a literary monument to Uncle Hyun Ki-young's short story, Uncle Suni.
Cherry blossoms bloom brilliantly as I look towards the Memorial Tower. The blue sea that flowed over the memorial tower was spreading asrai, giving comfort to my heart. I pressed my painful chest and quietly left Bukchon Village.
Cherry blossoms in full bloom with the memorial tower of Jeju Bukchon Village
One tomb buried by different ancestors, the site of the slaughter of six grains
At the edge of the Altre Airfield in southwestern Jeju, there are six grains. It is the site of a crushing slaughter that has arrived for a long time as if you were driving in a wild field. It is a place where people arrested in the preliminary arrest during the Korean War were collectively executed. At that time, those who were randomly caught and dragged were said to have left traces of themselves by throwing rubber-like belongings on the roadside in a truck that seemed to foresee the coming death.
Memorial memorial for victims of collective execution
The massacre surrounded by iron bars at the back of the memorial monument felt gloomy for some reason despite the sunlight. The two puddle seemed to go out into the ground. Spring flowers bloomed even on the heartless land that took many lives. Rapeseed flowers swaying along the wind felt sad, the soul of the victims.
The site of the slaughter of six grains that has taken numerous lives
“There is no one who has sinned / only the innocent is buried / white thirty two, the bones are entangled / one descendant comes.”
-The poet Ko Sung-gi is in the midst of commemorating the monumental cost
Entrance to Swanjo-ji Temple
Most of the victims of the grain were placed in nearby graveyards. Swanjoson Sonjimyo (百 묘 一 孫 之 墓), 132 different ancestors died at one place at a time, and the bones became tangled together, meaning that all of their descendants are now one descendant. In the past, it was called Baekjo Il Sonji (百 祖 一 孫 之 地). Due to the entrance control of the massacre to hide the incident, the survivors were unable to visit the body after several years. However, the bodies were already rotten and entangled, and eventually they had to saddle the 132 bodies with the skull, arms, and leg bones in place.
Victims saddled at a graveyard
Where else is this sad story? The wounds left by the Jeju 4/3 incident were deeper and darker than I thought. On the way back from the mausoleum, a spicy garlic scent that stuck in the tip of the nose stuck deep into my heart.
Sanbangsan Mountain rises over the monument.
Traces of Jeju 4/3 seen from travel destinations, Gwangchigi Beach's open-air trees & Darangshgul
Seongsan Ilchulbong Peak is one of the most famous spots for sunrise. Here, you can see traces of Jeju 4/3. This place, formerly known as 'Turjinmok', is a place where roads were repeatedly connected and cut off by land in the past.
Seongsan Ilchulbong can be seen clearly from the popped tree
It is said that many people in Seongsan-myeon were sacrificed during the Jeju 4/3 period. Now the son-in-law is still and peaceful as if it had happened. It seemed that he was struggling not to forget the memory of only the space comforting the souls becoming dull. If you stop by Gwangchigi Beach, take a moment of silence.
The exploded tree at Gwangchigi Beach, the site of Jeju 4/3
About 20 minutes by car from Seongsan Ilchulbong is Darangsioreum, which many tourists visit. It is said that there was a village of Daranche, which originated more than 100 years under the ascension, but all burned down during Jeju 4/3, and now only lush bamboo forests have a glimpse of the trace.
The site where Darangshgul was found
At the end of the road, which leads to a secluded trail on the road, there is the site of the Darangshgul. While running in dusty dust, the victims of Jeju 4/3 were found in the cave about a decade ago, and the news that caused shock and pain was dimly remembered. The Dalangshgul was a refuge for the residents of nearby Sehwa-ri and Jong-dal. The entrance to the oyster is now blocked.
Even the entrance is narrow and rugged
I recalled the inside of the cave seen from the Jeju 4 · 3 Peace Park Special Exhibition Hall. No matter how hard I tried, I couldn't imagine the escape life in a narrow and steep cave. Their hearts are throbbing and crying just as they would have been desperate.
Darangshgul at the time of excavation reproducing the remains and remains of the victim
Darangsi Oreum, which would have been watched silently all the time, is still imposing and generous. As the new skin revives even in deep wounds, I sincerely hope that this spring and all the coming springs of Jeju will shine brightly.
Darangsi Oreum seen from the site
Travel information

Jeju 4/3 Peace Park

-Address: 430 Myeonglim-ro, Jeju-si, Jeju Special Self-Governing Province

-Inquiries: 064-723-4344

https://jeju43peace.or.kr/


Nuven Monkey 4/3 Memorial

-Address: Bukchon 3-gil, Jocheon-eup, Jeju-si, Jeju Special Self-Governing Province

-Inquiries: 064-783-4303


Restaurants near

-Steamed story: Octopus Agu Seafood Steamed / 45-9 Sepyeonghang-ro, Gujwa-eup, Jeju-si, Jeju-si / 064-782-9969

-Today's Waffle Day: Fresh fruits and rainbow waffles / 2968 Ilju-dong-ro, Gujwa-eup, Jeju-si, Jeju-do / 070-8286-0176

https://www.instagram.com/ontheroad_dodo/


Rooms

-Olestay: 22, Jungjeong-ro, Seogwipo-si, Jeju Special Self-Governing Province / 064-762-2167 / Korean Tourism Quality Certification

https://korean.visitkorea.or.kr/detail/ms_detail.do?cotid=9ed9f232-ef40-4b66-b563-0923b1d0cdd2

-Cordelia Resort: 23-20 Iljudong-ro 4120beon-gil, Seongsan-eup, Seogwipo-si, Jeju Special Self-Governing Province / 070-4548-2200

http://cordelia.nsoft7.com/kor/

-Dream Nomad: 54, Millang-ro, Seogwipo-si, Jeju Special Self-Governing Province / 064-739-3114 / Korea Tourism Quality Certification

https://korean.visitkorea.or.kr/detail/ms_detail.do?cotid=f5066e7c-70fb-48b4-8013-6f808439c08c

item.title: A hidden spot in Jeju where you can take a selfie - Jeju City, Jeju, Korea
item.description:
A unique architecture Tessiphone on the Seongsidol Ranch

A hidden spot in Jeju where you can take a selfie

Jeju City, Jeju, Korea

Green and green, a field of green carpets spread out, and a white cloud over the blue sky is a strange and mysterious landscape. People who take pictures by pressing the camera shutter. Anyone who stands there becomes a model. Even the shy ones reveal themselves to their fullest, pose in various poses, and the youths fly up to the sky and radiate hopeful energy. Selfie sticks, which are popular these days, do not fall out. Travelers who wander around the selfie sticks and are not interested in taking their own photo shoots. Introducing the hidden spots of Jeju, which is famous for wedding photography for newlyweds and good for selfies.

Seongsidol Ranch, full of exotic emotions
A unique architecture standing alone at the edge of a blue field. Seongsidol Ranch is one of the places not to be missed when it comes to wedding photography on Jeju Island. The idyllic and peaceful atmosphere is a popular destination among photographers and photographers. Even though it is located in a remote place in the western mountains, the steps to find the knowing knowing constantly.
Take the Jungmun Expressway, pass Saebyeol Oreum, and follow the side road on the right. The road to the ranch is very lyrical. Horses grazing or resting among tall trees lined up on either side of the road unfold like a wonderful piece. After that, the field with soft grass is infinitely relaxed.
Horses grazing in the field by the way to the ranch
Around the edge of the ranch, there is a landmark building, the Teshphon. It is the most famous shooting spot in the Seongsidol Ranch. In many places, many commemorative photos, artworks and selfies are born. Tessiphone is a unique structure built in Baghdad, Iraq, about 2,000 years ago. It was said that it was used as a lodging facility when establishing a ranch, and has since been used for various purposes, such as a pig farm or feed mill. It is now a great shooting accessory for prospective brides and grooms.
Tessiphone, the landmark of Seongsidol Ranch
Photo enthusiasts and ordinary travelers also visit Tessiphone a lot. It looks old and shabby, but in the picture it looks very cool and exotic. Everyone becomes the main character of the pictorial here. On good days, you can get great pictures no matter how you take them. However, when it is not, it may be more disappointing than expected, so when the day is not good, it is better to empty your mind and go.
Teshphone, a photo spot
Teshphone is also the filming location for the 2014 drama Drama Mama. This is where Song Yoon-a went to teach her son a motorcycle. After filming and post-processing on the dash phone, it was aired in Canada.
Anyone here becomes the main character in the pictorial
Seopjikoji with a selfie photo
After raising one hand high, he smiles slightly upwards and makes a cute smile. This is the basic attitude for 'taking selfie sticks', which is spreading like a trend these days. When walking on Seopjikoji, you can see a lot of people taking pictures in this position.
Travelers taking pictures using selfie sticks
Seopjikoji is a very popular tourist destination, but many people pass through the all-in-house to the lighthouse. If you want to capture the true nature of Seopjikoji, go to the back of the lighthouse where people don't go much. Seongsan Ilchulbong is approaching Asrai beyond the ripples of the grass that began to turn yellow in early autumn. The walking trail around Seopjikoji is well organized to walk to the Aqua Planet.
Seopjikoji Field with blooming grass
Everywhere along the trail, lovers holding their selfie sticks stand side by side and smile happy. Make sure the photos are good, and change the seats around, leaving a commemorative photo. The background is so pretty that it is a satisfying expression no matter where you take it.
Lovers taking a selfie against the backdrop of a lighthouse
On one side of the hilly field, a simple horse riding experience takes place. If it's Lee Wang, it's worth taking the form and taking a picture. If you pose properly, you can get a nice photo that is close to the magazine cover.
Let's get on the horse and take some great photos
All-in-house, Seopjikoji's main photo zone, has recently been refurbished and transformed into a sweet place like a house made of sweets from a fairy tale. The quiet atmosphere and other gorgeous interiors are eye-catching. It's a pity that the old mood of the drama blended away disappears, but it's good to leave interesting pictures of other concepts.
The all-in house has been reopened as a sweet house
Travel information

Seongsi Stone Farm
-Address: 35 Geumak-dong-gil, Hallim-eup, Jeju-si, Jeju Special Self-Governing Province
-Inquiries: 064-796-0396


Seopjikoji
-Address: 107 Seopjikoji-ro, Seongsan-eup, Seogwipo-si, Jeju Special Self-Governing Province
-Inquiries: 064-740-6000


Restaurants near

Onpyeong Local Local Restaurant: Sea cucumber tortilla, Seafood Assortment / 403, Hwanhaejangseong-ro, Seongsan-eup, Seogwipo-si / 064-782-8689

Vacation shabu-shabu: Shabu-shabu / 595, Sinbuk-ro, Jocheon-eup, Jeju-si / 064-784-4645

Sea Feast: Grilled fish, boiled fish, sashimi / 79, Tapdong-ro, Jeju-si / 064-702-8989

Rooms

Sunshine Pension: 284-4, Ilchul-ro, Seongsan-eup, Seogwipo-si / 010-3408-6767

http://www.villalucis.co.kr/

Maple Hotel: 41 Wonnohyeong 3-gil, Jeju-si / 064-745-6775

http://www.hotelmaple.com/

item.title: Which sea will you jump into this summer ?! A collection of the best beaches in Jeju - Jeju City, Jeju, Korea
item.description:
The only one in Korea that has a hot flush

Which sea will you jump into this summer ?! A collection of the best beaches in Jeju

Jeju City, Jeju, Korea

The weather is over 30 degrees, and it makes you realize that summer is approaching. When it's hot, jumping into the sea is the best way to go. Jeju Island where the slope is surrounded by the sea and you can meet the beach anywhere you go. It is the same island, but we collected Jeju's best beaches that attract tourists with different charms.

This is Jeju's representative beach! Hamdeok vs Hyeopjae Beach

If you choose the representative beaches in Jeju, you can't miss Hamdeok Seowoobong and Hyeopjae Beach. Moreover, Hamdeok is located in the east and Hyeopjae in the west, and it is naturally a beach representing Jeju's east and west. Both attract a large number of visitors each year with clear, clean seas, beautiful scenery and well-equipped facilities.

Hamdeok Seowoobong Beach can be easily found from Jeju International Airport along the Ilju Road for 30-40 minutes east of Seongsan Ilchulbong. There are many amenities such as hotels, resorts, and restaurants around the beach, making it especially popular with families. In summer, it is crowded with outdoor tents and camping tents in various tents. You can even order food from the beach. During the high season, various festivals are held in addition to the opening of the night.

Hamdeok Seowoobong Beach is open at night

However, the reason why Seowoobong Beach in Hamdeok is considered as a representative beach in the eastern part of Jeju is not because it is well equipped with amusement facilities. Above all, it is thanks to the beautiful natural scenery of the beach. The scenery created by the combination of several beaches created by the jagged coastline and Seowoobong towering at the end is not unusual. In addition, the trail to the summit of Seowoobong is well-maintained, so there are other things to enjoy besides sea bathing. There is no superb view of the beach looking up from here.

The tenters under a palm tree

Seongsegi Beach, Gimnyeong, about 10 minutes from Hamdeok, is another representative beach in the eastern region. It is famous for its white fine white sand like flour and has a relatively quiet and quiet atmosphere. You can make your own space on the large white sandy beach, and enjoy the leisurely tanning alone, listen to music, or read the audiences reading. Wind turbines standing at the end of the white sand and yachts floating near the shoreline add exotic flavor.

Yo...

Hyeopjae Beach, which represents the western part of Jeju, has well-equipped facilities as well as Hamdeok Seowoobong, attracting many visitors every year. Compared to Hamdeok, it is characterized by a wider distribution of guest houses and guest houses than large facilities such as hotels and resorts. So perhaps Hyeopjae has a lot of young tourists, and thanks to him, he has a more free and lively atmosphere. Of course, it is also suitable for family travelers. When the water is drained, the white sandy beach, which is widely exposed, is endless even if you go. The white sandy beach where water is splashed is a good playground for small children.

A summer vacationer enjoying tanning under the hot sun

Whatever it is, if it is Hyeopjae Beach, it is also Biyangdo. Biyangdo, which stands out in the middle of the sea, is a landscape that marks the beauty of Hyeopjae. Hyeopjae Beach without unreasonableness is unimaginable. Biyangdo, a small island created by a volcanic eruption tens of thousands of years ago, creates a fantasy for everyone who seeks Hyeopjae. It is an island of mystery that sometimes appears vividly and sometimes faintly like a mirage floating on the sea. It looks close enough to walk at low tide, but it takes about 15 minutes by boat from Hallim Port to get to Biyangdo. If you have time, you may want to plan a trip to Biyangdo Island. One or two hours is enough to tour Biyangdo. However, since there aren't many ships, you need to calculate time.
The Geumneung Beach, a 5-minute walk from Hyeopjae, is also worth a visit. Unlike Hyeopjae, it feels small and cozy. It's not as beautiful as any beach, but it's even careful to soak your feet in the clear water that looks deep inside. Snorkeling at Geumneung Beach makes you forget about the heat of the summer and provides pleasant memories.

You can enter Biyangdo if you have time.
Water sports in summer too! Jungmun vs Sinyang Beach

Another enjoyment of summer beaches is water leisure sports. Jeju also has several beaches where you can enjoy snorkeling, scuba diving, surfing, and more. Among them, Jungmun Saekdal Beach and Sinyangseopjikoji Beach are the representative places. Jungmun Saekdal Beach in Jungmun Tourist Complex is famous for gathering surfers.

Shinyangseopjikoji Beach with Seongsan Ilchulbong Peak
There are many hotels and resorts nearby, so there are many tourists who come to the beach for bathing, but the waves are stronger than others, making it suitable for surfing. Just watching the surfers riding the surf is a cool and fun thing to see. If you don't get into the castle just by watching, you can also try surfing yourself.
Shinyangseopjikoji Beach with Seongsan Ilchulbong Peak

Shinyangseopjikoji Beach spreading near Seopjikoji can be seen by windsurfers on a windy day. The beach is formed in a wide semi-circular shape, so the waves are gentle even when the wind blows. Thanks to this, it is considered the best place for windsurfing. Windsurfers who swim freely around the waves cannot seem so envious. There are places where you can rent or teach windsurfing equipment on the beach, so even beginners can learn easily if they want to.

Shinyangseopjikoji Beach Windsurfers
Hidden beach on the island, Udo Hongjodan Beach & Hagosudong Beach
Udo, an island in the island, has the Hongjo Dango Beach, famous for ‘Seobin Baeksa’, and another hidden beach, Hagosudong Beach. Designated as a natural monument, the red algae lump beach is a unique beach formed by shaving white hardened coral like coral after the death of lime algae called red algae. When the sun is shining, the beach glows white enough to shine. Unlike the fine white sand beach, the red algae on the soles of the feet are amazing.
The red sea lump beach of Udo formed by the hardening of red algae
Be careful because it is a natural monument and it is forbidden to bring them out. The dazzling beach and the emerald sea are the perfect expressions for a dream paradise.
It is overflowing with people in the summer season

Unlike the Hongjo Dango Habin, which has a well-known reputation, Hado-Sudong Beach is a little less known. These days, this place is also crowded with people who come to know what to know. It is an impressive beach with a statue of Haenyeo standing against the backdrop of the jade sea. The sand here is very fine. It is the same island, but the different beach scenery makes Jeju a more attractive island.

Hagosu-dong Beach with the statue of Haenyeo
Woljeong-ri Beach
Let's stop by Woljeong-ri Beach as a place to float these days. A place that was a secluded beach only two or three years ago has now become the hottest area on Jeju Island.
Woljeongri Beach, one of the hot spots in Jeju Island
In clear and clear weather, a wonderful view unfolds before your eyes as if you were in a resort in the Mediterranean Sea. There are cafes that show different personalities along the coastal road, so you can enjoy a different mood.
Woljeongri Beach, one of the hot spots
Avoid a hot sun and sit in a café with a good view and drink a cup of sour and sour water and look out at the sea.
It's good to take a break at a cafe with a cool drink
It's good to take a break at a cafe with a cool drink
Travel information

1.Nearby Restaurants

Donsadon: Muscle meat / 19 Woopyeong-ro, Jeju-si / 064-746-8989

Soup noodles: Gogi-guksu / 17 Jewon-gil, Jeju-si / 064-742-7355

Black Hanwoom Gallery: Black Hanwoo / 8421 Iljudong-ro, Seogwipo-si / 064-732-1486

http://www.seogwiposi.com/index.php/contents/black_beef/intro

Manjoicheon Rice: Dolsot Icheon Rice Rice, Cheonggukjang (Miso) / 5 Seongsanjungang-ro, Seongsan-eup, Seogwipo-si / 064-784-9793

ICC Jeju Family Restaurant Delgia: Jeju Local Food, Pasta / 224 Jungmun Tourist Road, Seogwipo City / 064-738-6400

http://www.iccjeju.co.kr/Facilities/Delizia

2.Accommodation

Seogwipo KAL Hotel : 242, Chilsimni-ro, Seogwipo-si / 064-733-2001

http://www.kalhotel.co.kr/seogwipo/

※ The above information was updated in June 2018, and may be changed later, so please check before you travel.

item.title: Where do we go, dad? To find the hidden secret of Jeju! Exploring Jeju Jimmy Peak - Jeju City, Jeju, Korea
item.description:
<Dad! Jimmy Bong introduced in Where Are You Going?

Where do we go, dad? To find the hidden secret of Jeju! Exploring Jeju Jimmy Peak

Jeju City, Jeju, Korea

<Dad! Where are you going?> The team came to Jeju! Let's go to Jimibong, where broadcaster Kim Seong-ju and his golden son Min-kuk climbed together.

Scenery where the sea and sky meet

Jimmy Bong that stands on the shore of Hadori Village in Gujwa-eup, Jeju. Jimmy Peak, also known as Jeju Island's end of the earth, is a superb view of Udo, Seongsan Ilchulbong, Migratory Birds, and Mt. Halla as well as the emerald sea. It is one of the most representative representatives of the eastern Jeju region. It was one of Jeju's hidden sights that only those who knew so far knew, but as it was included in the Olle 21 course, which opened last year, many people climbed the peaks along the Olle trail. In particular, <Daddy! Where are you going?> As the team visits Jimmy Bong, more travelers are just aiming for Jimmy Bong.

Jimmy Bong, find the entrance!
<Dad! Where are you going?> Sung-joo Kim, the father of the team, visits Jimmy Bong with his son Min-guk. “I've arrived at the destination” looks around according to the navigation guide, but looks somewhat unpredictable. Obviously, Jimmy Bong can be seen nearby. Eventually, I come down the road where I came to the conclusion that it may not be this way.

Is this setting for fun broadcasting? Not like that. Jimmy Bong, like Min-guk and Dad, can't find the entrance easily, so there are quite a lot of travelers. <Dad! After seeing Where?>, Two female college students who put Jimmy Bong on a mandatory course during their trip to Jeju, wandered around the Udo Pier, where they can see Jimmy Bong.

“Jimbong is close, but the entrance is not visible right away.”

Marks erected at the entrance of Jimmy Bong

Many people who have come to Jimmy Bong, like Korea or two female college students, are often unable to find or pass through the entrance. If so, was the entrance hidden? That is never. When you find the entrance, you will often wander around close enough to make a nice laugh by saying ‘Aha ~!’ It is the easiest way to find the trail along the Olle Trail, but you can easily find the entrance by surprisingly skimming around the Jimbong.

Jimmy Bong passes through Olle 21 course
Climbing the un-green Jimmy Peak

On the second day, this time, I joined the sisters I met during the trip, and once again, I challenged to find the entrance to Jimmy Bong. As I traced back the path I walked yesterday, the entrance reveals a pouting place where I said, 'It's not that way.'

"haha! I couldn't see it yesterday, but ... ! ”

As if trying to make up for yesterday's failure, the two friends, who burst into laughter with the party, take a light step first.

Beginning to climb Jimmy Bong, like a Korean, is just as enjoyable. As soon as I climbed it, I wondered if I had walked through a forest path with a cool shade of trees and a steep staircase appeared. The road to step by step is not green. Jimmy Bong is not a very high climb of 165m above sea level and 150m above sea level. However, due to the steep slope, you have to take some effort to reach the top.
Going through a shaded forest path
Ascending looking up

When the light steps felt a little heavy, it seemed like Sung-Ju Kim's voice was heard somewhere like a hallucinations.

“… If it's hard ... You can give up ... ”

Kim Sung-joo, a father who talked tenderly to Min-guk, who was somewhat in trouble, seemingly unhappy. After that, Minkook stepped on the summit before his father, but he faced reality, so the summit is still far away.

Let's go back and see the scenery in the middle of the climb

Ah, it's harder than I thought, but should I turn around or not? Shall we go a little further, go down, come again next time… All sorts of temptations and anguish disturb the mind and make the steps go back. The moment I look back on the road I've been up to now, let's take a break and say, "Oh!" The elasticity that pops out comes out. Everyone hardens like a stone. The landscape that was unimaginable before the climb was unfolding before your eyes.

Let's go back and see the scenery in the middle of the climb

The beautiful scenery of the sea, sky, and branches shining as if the paint was released, and the beautiful scenery created by Udo Island compensate for all the trouble. Everyone looks fascinated for a moment. After waking up, I was fully replenished with the energy I had just exhausted. Now, back to the top!

Seongsan Ilchulbong can be seen through the trees
Jimmy Bong should go up, too!
A few times, Minkuk continued to climb and climb the same path. I finally got to the top. Jimmy Bong has a horseshoe that has collapsed on one side of the crater, and does not have a trail to look around the crater like any ascent.
The surrounding scenery seen from the top of Jimmy Peak
Instead, the scenery spread like a 360-degree panorama at the summit raises your thumb.
You can see the outstanding scenery of various ascensions
The first thing that catches your eye is the sea of Jeju, which has a beautiful water color. Also, it is a view of Udo and Seongsan Ilchulbong, which seem to have been placed upon spraying. It's a different feeling from the scenery I saw at the midpoint. As for the ascension, it must be raised to the top, so it tastes good! The scenery that catches the eye changes with each direction.
Udo and Seongsan Ilchulbong faced as if floating on the sea
The scenery of the village where farmhouse houses of Onggi-jonggi are gathered is also beautiful, and Hallasan Mountain, which has been faintly seen over the convex and rising hills, adds a mystery. Along with the Hado Migratory Bird, which raises curiosity as if it were not the ocean, the Jongdo-ri Udo Wharf, which I wandered with my friends yesterday, is caught at a glance.
The emerald sea from Jimmy Peak

How long has it been? Just like the saying that there is no business in front of a beauty, which traveler can easily take a step forward with the hidden unexplored Jeju in front? Jimmy Bong is a lovely ascendant full of charm that makes the camera continually indulge in admiration wherever you turn your eyes.

Houses gathered under the Jimmy Bong
Let's shout “I love you!” To someone who comes to mind, just like Minkuk yelled “I love you!” At the top of Jimmy Bong. Just be quiet and shout out loud in your mood or in your mind. Let's not forget that shouting or yelling 'Yah!'
Houses gathered under the Jimmy Bong
Visit the picturesque landscape

Unfortunately, it's time to go down Jimibong. Turn the steps that don't fall off and head down again. The steps are lighter than when climbing. If you're a bit unhappy, it's also an interesting trip to visit the scenery you saw in Oreum one after another. You can visit the nearest Hado migratory birds for a quiet time to ponder, or take a boat from Udang Wharf to enter Udo. Looking up at the peak of Seongsan Ilchulbong or another hill and looking at Jimmy Peak is another unique memory.

Udo Pier at Jongdal-ri near Jimmybong
Travel information

Way to go

* Self-driving

Jeju International Airport → Yongmun-ro → Turn right at City Hall at Wolseong Intersection → 9 o'clock direction at City Hall at Orao Street → Turn left at Samyang Checkpoint Intersection → Ilju-dong Road → Turn left at Jongdal Intersection → Turn left toward Jongdal, Coastal Road → Jongdal-ro 1-gil → Jimmy Bong

* public transport

Take the same route from Jeju Intercity Bus Terminal and get off at Jongdal. About 15 minutes on foot to Jimmy Bong

Restaurants near

-Seongsan Potuk Exhaust: Haemultuk Exhaust / 236, Ilchul-ro, Seongsan-eup, Seogwipo-si / 064-784-8940

-Baeknok Hall: Live fish society / 222, Ilchul-ro, Seongsan-eup, Seogwipo-si / 064-782-8001, 064-782-8002

-Samdajeong: Buffet / 80, Noyeon-ro, Jeju-si / 064-747-4900

http://www.grand.co.kr/contents/?mid=KR101111

Rooms

-MK Jeju Hotel: 160 Sindae-ro, Jeju-si / 064-747-0202
-Jeju Grand Hotel: 80, Noyeon-ro, Jeju-si / 064-747-4900

http://www.grand.co.kr

-Hotel Hana: 53 Jungmun Tourist Road 72beon-gil, Seogwipo-si / 064-738-7001, 064-738-7011

http://www.benikea.com/

item.title: From 5 AM to 3 PM! Jeju Haejangguk Time - Jeju City, Jeju, Korea
item.description:
Jeju Island Bay Haejangguk Time

From 5 AM to 3 PM! Jeju Haejangguk Time

Jeju City, Jeju, Korea

Haejangguk. Usually, it is a generic term for 'a soup eaten to relieve hangover'. But these days it is not necessarily the case. It is a simple and nutritious food that fills the inside, making it a favorite food for all ages. In Jeju Island, these Haejangguk houses are exceptionally noticeable. It's a little exaggerated, so you can easily find it wherever you go. Jeju people's love of Haejangguk seems unusual. What is unique is that most of the Haejangguk Jeju Islands open at dawn and close at 3pm. When it comes to closing time, the house that is rumored to be ‘it ’s not good.’ From 5 am to 3 pm. Jeju Island's Haejangguk time is back

Its addictive taste! Breeze Haejangguk

Haejangguk is the first place in Jeju. Regardless of whether you have eaten it or not, the ‘mipoong’ equation is commonly used among people in Haejangguk. A bowl of spicy and generous Haejangguk not only hangs up overnight, but also makes the journey early in the morning.

Haejanggukjip The reason why Mipung Haejangguk stands out even in many Jeju islands is the 'unchanging taste' that has been observed for many years. Mipung Haejangguk, which boasts a tradition of over 40 years, is famous for its unique addictive taste. The reason why it is essential to become a regular once a regular, is still sincerity and honesty with the same taste even after several decades.
Mifeng Haejangguk Entrance
The first secret of this house, which is based on the Seonji Haejangguk, is the broth that has been brewed without fear. Mipung Haejangguk, CEO of New Jeju Kim Jae-hyung, tries hard to draw broth every day. It's a hard work that requires you to sweat and work for hours, but thanks to that, the soup is much richer and deeper. The second trick is homemade red chili oil sauce. The spicy and savory taste of the breeze comes from this sauce. 'No comment' is not only how to draw broth, but also how to make seasoning. Here, Zenji, Guernsey, bean sprouts, and Siraegi are filled with pots.
Haejangguk
The peculiar thing is that if you ask to remove or add more ingredients according to your preference when ordering, you will be served accordingly. This is thanks to the fact that the ingredients are prepared separately and when the order comes in, the soup is poured into the pot and boiled once more. For this reason, the original taste and texture of each ingredient comes out. ‘Kakduk-guk’ is a delicacy that makes Haejangguk even more delicious. If you take a sip before meals, the cool and sour taste will boost your taste buds.
You can order without the sauce.
Mipung Haejangguk, which originated from the vicinity of the Central Cathedral of Jeju City, now operates a Haejanggukjip with the same name as its son, daughter, and daughter-in-law all over Jeju. So-called family chain. Last year, it was named as a family succession company selected by Jeju Provincial Government. Seonji Haejangguk 7,000 won.
Cool and sour soup
Sweet taste is excellent! Eun Hee Haejangguk
Eunhee Ne Haejangguk, located in the alley of the old downtown area, is famous for Beef Haejangguk. Haejangguk has only one menu. Around the morning or lunch, people who come to eat Haejangguk often have a parking war, not a time on a secluded alley.
Eunhee Ne Haejangguk
When it is crowded, there is the trouble of waiting for a vacant seat to be empty, but as soon as you sit down, you can quickly get the boiling pot of rice. Inside the pot is full of boiled soup, it is full of thick paper and yangji, bean sprouts and siraegi, and vermicelli. Especially, soybean sprouts are added in plenty so that it can be called as bean sprouts. Depending on your preference, Sunji can order more or less.
Haejangguk

Haejangguk, which seems to be very spicy at first glance, comes back with a twist as soon as a spoonful floats. I am surprised by the spicy taste, and twice by the sweet taste. That is why children eat well soon. It is also a taste that people who are new to Haejangguk can eat without hesitation. If you add chopped garlic properly, the flavor will be deeper.

Kitchen with open kitchen

The kitchen is an open kitchen with a clear view of the inside, so you can see the whole process of Haejangguk. As in the Mipung Haejangguk, the ingredients are prepared separately. When an order comes in, pour the broth into the pot and boil again. Boiled pots placed neatly on the top of the eagle, show the sincere stubbornness of this house. Beef Haejangguk 7,000 won.

Spicy beef soup
A big bone is full! Bijidang Restaurant
Haejangguk is a popular menu item that can be found at any time in Jeju, as well as in downtown areas. Bijigot Restaurant, located in Pyeongdae-ri, Gujwa-eup, is a home renowned for its delicious bone soup. It is located on the side of Ilju road leading to Seongsan Ilchulbong, and many people go to work early in the morning.
Visiting restaurant
The restaurant is rather shabby, but there is no shortage of places to eat one meal. Although it is less neat, such as downtown and tourist spots, it is a place that many locals visit, so it feels full of the atmosphere. At lunchtime, people often have to wait until they are full.
Haejangguk

Bony Haejangguk, with its thick flesh, just looks over at the saliva. It is a dish that tastes great with the broth that has been crushed for a long time. 3 ~ 4 bones are so big that they appear small enough to appear small, and even if you eat only the meat attached to it, your stomach will swell. Where is that? Even a pot of pork bones, one that looks strong, is added as a bonus. Grab it like an ice cream, eat it cleanly, and eat the bone marrow in your ear.

Pork knee bones one by one

Another advantage is that it does not have any peculiar smell of pigs because it uses only Jeju pigs. Here, the boiled boiled ooze adds a rich flavor. The only thing that entered Haejangguk is pork bones and beef. But that is enough. It is a feeling that the moderately thick and savory broth will keep the empty stomach. One bowl of Bone Haejangguk soup enjoys the best of both eyes and mouth. Another attractive point! It tastes good, but it's nice to the price. Bony Haejangguk (Korean haejangguk) is 6,000 won.

The fun of skipping bone marrow
Also recommended here! Gwangyang Haejangguk & Moise Haejangguk

Located near Jeju City Hall, Gwangyang Haejangguk is home to many regular workers. Haejangguk, which is made with sliced sesame seeds and meat, is also delicious, but the savory and mildly flavored naejangtang is also popular. On the contrary, there are many customers who visit this house because they are stuck in Naejangtang. The interior is also spacious and comfortable. Haejangguk 7,000 won, Naejangtang 8,000 won.

Gwangyang Haejangguk Naejangtang

Moise Haejangguk, which has chain stores all over Jeju City, is loved by both locals and travelers. The main office of Nohyeong-dong is large, so it is often visited by groups. The characteristic of this house is that it has a variety of Haejangguk menu. You can choose and eat according to your taste, such as seonji, bean sprouts, and oyster soup. It is the only Jeju Haejangguk house that is open 24 hours a day. Haejangguk 6,500 ~ 7,500 won.

Moise Haejangguk with egg
Travel information

Mipoong Haejangguk: 15, Yeondong 11-gil, Jeju-si, 064-749-6776
Eunhee's Haejangguk: 8 Goma-ro 13-gil, Jeju-si, 064-726-5622
Visiting restaurant: 3002 Iljudong-ro, Gujwa-eup, Jeju-si, 064-784-7080
Gwangyang Haejangguk: 25, Gwangyang 13-gil, Jeju-si, 064-751-1777
Moise Haejangguk: 24, Wonnohyeongnam 1-gil, Jeju-si, 064-746-5128

1.Access

* Self-driving

Mipoong Haejangguk (Sinjeju Branch): Jeju International Airport → Gonghang-ro → Sin-daero → Yeongdong 11-gil → Mipoong Haejangguk
Eunhee's Haejangguk: Jeju International Airport → Yongmun-ro → Wolseong-ro → Seogwang-ro → Gomaro → Gomaro 13-gil → Eunhee Ne Haejangguk
Visiting restaurant: Jeju International Airport → Yeonsam-ro → Beonyeong-ro → Bijarim-ro → Ilju-dong-ro → Bijidang Restaurant
Gwangyang Haejangguk: Jeju International Airport → Yongmun-ro → Wolseong-ro → Seogwang-ro → Donggwang-ro 6-gil → Gwangyang 11-gil → Gwangyang Haejangguk
Moise Haejangguk (Main Branch): Jeju International Airport → Gonghang-ro → Sindaero → Noyeon-ro → Wonnohyeong-ro → Wonnohyeongnam 1-gil → Moise Haejangguk


* public transport

Mipoong Haejangguk (Sinjeju Branch): Take bus number 37 from Jeju International Airport and get off at Suhyup Jeju Island Branch. 3 minutes on foot
Eunhee's Haejangguk: Take bus number 100 from Jeju International Airport and get off at Inhwa-dong. 2-minute walk
Visiting restaurant: Take bus number 700 from Jeju Intercity Terminal and get off at Pyeongdae Office. 2-minute walk
Gwangyang Haejangguk: Take bus number 100 from Jeju International Airport and get off at Gwangyang. 8 minutes on foot
Moise Haejangguk (Main Branch): 5 minute walk from Jeju International Airport to Daho Village Station. Take bus 887 to Namnyeonggo. 6 minutes on foot


2. Restaurants around

Haioreum Restaurant: Jeonbok Ttukbaegi / 260, Ilchul-ro, Seongsan-eup, Seogwipo-si / 064-782-2256

Once upon a time: Dome...

Golden Good Burger: Golden Rung Burger / 434 Chiljeon-ro, Daejeong-eup, Seogwipo-si / 064-773-0097

3.Accommodation

Yerae Pension: 527 Yeraehaean-ro, Seogwipo-si / 010-9744-7768

UTS Golf Village: 170-2, Gwangnyeongpyeonghwa 2-gil, Aewol-eup, Jeju-si / 064-799-0794, 064-799-0795

http://www.utsjeju.com/
Well Resort: 297, Ear Road, Seogwipo City / 064-738-4000

http://www.wellresort.co.kr/

item.title: Door to Seonggye 'Jeju Bangseonmun Valley' - Jeju City, Jeju, Korea
item.description:
When you go up the agar, you can see Bangseonmun Valley

Door to Seonggye 'Jeju Bangseonmun Valley'

Jeju City, Jeju, Korea

If you get out of the hustle and bustle, you will soon encounter a door leading to Seonggye. Bangseonmun Valley where freshness came and stayed. The mysterious scenery of rock and rock formations in the valley captures the heart at once.

The Bangseonmun Valley was located upstream of Hancheon, the longest river in Jeju Island. Since ancient times, many scholars and poets have visited and enjoyed the wind, and it has a superb view that is considered to be one of the 10 best places in Yeongju. One of them, 'Yeonggu Chunhwa', refers to the spring scenery of the Bangseonmun Valley, and the flowers blooming around the valley reflect beautifully in the valley water. Yeongsanhong and true flowers bloom in every place where the gaze touches, and even if you look at it, it will heal itself.

Bangseonmun cover seat at the entrance of the valley

Unfortunately, there aren't many days where you can admire this view. Since the agar that forms the basis of the Bangseonmun Valley is a dry stream, the water does not open until rain or snow accumulated in the winter melts. In order to tackle ‘Yeongguchunhwa’ in the Bangseonmun Valley, it is time to get along well in the spring.

Guide and Dolharbang standing at the entrance of Bangseonmun Valley
Invitation to the new world, Bangseonmun Valley

However, we cannot wait only when it rains. Even if you missed 'Yeongu Chunhwa', the Bangseonmun Valley itself is attractive enough, so I recommend you to visit it at any time. It is only a 10-minute drive from downtown Jeju, and when entering the valley, a mysterious landscape with a completely different dimension unfolds. Even in a valley where water does not flow, the terrain and geology surrounding the valley are so mysterious that it is difficult to escape easily once you step in. As if entering a new world, he is obsessed with strange feelings, and he continues to rush through the rocks.

Bangseonmun Valley with unique geological structure

Originally, the Bangseonmun Valley was called ‘Deunggung-gwe’, but in Jeju, it means ‘a rock that was lifted through a hole’. It is also referred to as ‘Deungyong-gu’ by borrowing the kanji, and recently it was named Bangseonmun, which means ‘the place where Shinseon visits’. The name Bang Sun-moon comes from a legend that has been passed down for a long time. According to legend, every year on a lucky day, the fairies descended from the sky and bathed in Baeknokdam, and every time Hallasan Mountain God had to go beyond the large rock gate in the valley to the human world. It is a story that one day, the mountain god of Hallasan broke it and stole the appearance of the fairies taking a bath and then wandered Baeknokdam as a white deer with the wrath of the Jade Emperor. The funny legend attached to the name makes me laugh.

There is a huge arched hole in the rock.

If you go down the wooden stairs at the entrance to the valley, you will see a huge rock formation, which is the Bangseonmun Gate. It looks like a door when viewed from a distance, with a hole large enough for dozens of people to fly in and out of a huge rock, like a cave that has been drilled back and forth. Especially when it is rainy or overcast on a cloudy day, even the spiritual energy is wrapped around the rocky gate. It feels like a door connecting the world to the world.

Information signs of Bangseonmun Valley

Seeing the works that nature has cultivated for a long time, did the old ancestors think the same way? It is easy to find Maae-myeong (磨 崖 銘, written on a rock), which has inspirations for it. There are more than 50 names in the Bangseonmun Valley, and there are still many bright letters, so their historical value is high.

A small cow standing under the rock after the rain
The Bangseonmun Valley, which combines historical and cultural elements and natural scenery, was recognized for its value in 2013 and was designated as a National Designated Cultural Heritage Myeongseung No. 92.
The name of the devil who is seen all over the rock
Trekking the valley to inspire exploration

If you turn your eyes around the rock gate, the scenery there is not unusual. Rocks that curve like gentle waves fill the valley, and trees that are firmly rooted in a barren environment without a handful of dirt between the rocky cliffs create exclamation. How can there be such a landscape?

Stairs going down the Bangseonmun Valley
Curiosity comes after novelties and surprises. The footsteps quickly rush the way up the valley.
Thick moss on the tree

Trekking in the Bangseonmun Valley is almost an exploration, as there are no well-polished paths or separate guide signs. Therefore, you should always be aware of your way back and be safe. Don't go where it looks dangerous, and it's a good idea to accompany your party.

Trees growing on rock cliffs

If you cross over a rocky valley, you will see a cow with standing water. This is the place where you can see it only on rainy days. Because of luck, raindrops began to fall from the cloudy sky on the first day I visited the Bangseonmun Valley, and water quickly flowed into the valley. 'Biwaya Falls', which is difficult to see even after a few visits, welcomed strangers. In fact, it is a mini waterfall that is a little shy to call it a waterfall after a short fall, but for some reason it looks good with the Bangseonmun Valley.

Rocks wet with rain create a strange atmosphere.

As if the valley rocks, wet with rain, were painted with oil, it seems to have been applied with a varnish. Fortunately, it's not as slippery as it looks. Nevertheless, there was no section where the hiking boots you reported were so dangerous.

Trekking in Bangseonmun Valley
It was hard to see the valley where the water was so full of water that it had just stopped raining, but this was the time. It's like feeling like you're back on an isolated planet, exploring back and forth. The first encounter with the amazing and mysterious Bangseonmun Valley remains an unforgettable memory.
Since there is no separate route, you should pay attention to safety
Some ways to enjoy Bangseonmun Valley
In the meantime, the Bangseonmun Valley has not been known much more than the magnificent scenery. Thanks to this, along with the title of “hidden unexplored” in Jeju City, it remains untouched for many years and remains the same as the ancestors enjoyed the wind. These days, as the beautiful scenery of Bangseonmun Valley is spread through the Internet, more and more people are looking for it. This is Yoo Bae-gil, Choi Ik-hyun of Myeonam, and there are several ‘roads’ that go through Bangseonmun Valley, including Aura Ollegil. In particular, Aura Olle-gil is a course that follows the agar from Koji Bridge to Bangseonmun Valley and is worth a walk. It is good to walk along a forest path along the river as if you were taking a leisurely stroll. It takes about 2 to 2 hours and a half to reach 5 km from Yeolanjioreum through Bangseonmun Valley. On the way, there are many things to see, such as an appeal, so it is not boring.
For a family trip, you can take a round tour of the valley lightly and then drop by an experiential learning center nearby. The Bangseonmun Valley Chocolate Experience Center (064-744-0093), located next to the Jeju Art Center, runs several experiences that children will love, such as making chocolate.
Every May, a festival (Bangseonmun Festival Committee 064-728-4802) is held around the Bangseonmun Valley. There are also concerts to sit on the cool valley rocks and watch them, and there are small but fruitful programs such as baekiljang, poetry song, and pungryu yard. If the schedule of the Bangseonmun Festival overlaps during your trip to Jeju, take some time to stop by. It brings a little fun to the journey.
bar
Travel information

1.Access

* Self-driving

Jeju International Airport → Gonghang-ro → Sindaero → Turn right toward Onam-ro → Turn left at the first intersection → Turn right toward Bangseonmun Valley → Entrance to Bangseonmun Valley

* public transport

There is no bus to Bangseonmun Valley. It takes about 20 minutes by taxi from the airport. Around 10,000 won

2. Restaurants around

Haenyeo Sashimi Restaurant: Dageum Bari · Dome / 33, Topdong-ro, Jeju-si / 064-724-6212

Large Mahal: Tandoori Chicken, Curry, Nan / 39 Shingwang-ro, Jeju-si / 064-749-4924

3.Accommodation

Impress Hotel: 28, Imhang-ro, Jeju-si / 064-756-7777

Baume Couture Hotel: 95, Singwang-ro, Jeju-si / 064-798-8000 / korean.visitkorea.or.kr

http://www.baume.co.kr/

※ The above information was created in March 2013, and may be changed later, so be sure to check it before you travel.
※ Information, such as text, photos, and videos used in this article, is copyrighted by the Korea Tourism Organization, and unauthorized use of the article is prohibited.

item.title: Andong Alley Hidden restaurant, where have you been? - Andong City, Gyeongbuk, Korea
item.description:
Grilled Korean beef ribs at Andong Ribs Street

Andong Alley Hidden restaurant, where have you been?

Andong City, Gyeongbuk, Korea

I miss the taste of the warm hometown in the season of hanging the collar in the cold wind. Let's go to Andong, a city where delicious local food is delicious. From Andong Steamed Chicken, Andong Hutje Ssap, Andong Gan mackerel, you can taste unimaginable food except for Andong, and there are many hidden restaurants. Grilled ribs, seonji gukbap, and gyeongsangdo-style chueotang, which will confirm the reputation of Andong Korean beef, are lined by Andongguksi and Naengwoodong, the culmination of lightness. The pilgrimage to Andong restaurant with history and tradition starts from the rib street in front of Andong Station.
5 hidden restaurants that are proven by tradition and taste
When planning a trip, searching for restaurants is a must-have course. When you search for Andong restaurants, Andong jjimdak in the old market jjimdak alley appears first, and the Andong Dam Wolyeonggyo traditional food street, the famous ‘Gakjipjipji’, and the Andong Ganjeok that can be found anywhere in Andong. In search, I asked the natives of Andong, who weren't in the castle, a hidden restaurant that was verified by history, tradition, and taste in addition to Andong's three major delicacies.
'Okya Restaurant''s Seonji Gukbap
Grilled Korean beef ribs at Andong Rib alley in front of Andong Station, and Sunji Gukbap of 'Okya Restaurant' in Andong New Market Food Alley, Cold Udon with 34-year old tradition, Gyeongsangdo Chueotang, Hahoe From the farmhouse guest house near the village to Andong-guk-si, which is made by the villagers, we received fifty hidden restaurants that everyone who knows and knows and visits. When traveling to Andong, if you have this much menu, no matter where you go or who you are, you don't have any problem.
Andong Geonjin Noodles of “Park Jae-sook Farmer Homestay”
Two special services on Korean beef ribs
If you go in front of Andong Station, there is Andong Ribs Alley. Thirty years ago, it started with one or two ribs, not to mention ribs, but it has been growing one by one, and 15 ribs are now in business. Andong-style seasoned ribs are soy sauce seasoned with fresh garlic and fruit juice, and are served at the same time as the order, so you have to use good ribs. So, of course, it is fresh and delicious.
Grilled Korean beef ribs at 'New Seoul Ribs'
After eating the charcoal-grilled ribs, you can enjoy the spicy rib stew and spicy rib stew. It's best cooked on a charcoal fire and cooked with spicy ribs after removing the meat on a rib that can't be burned or chewy. Even if you choose chewy ribs and eat the rice with the remaining seasoning, it is also delicious. The miso stew, boiled with soybean paste soaked in the countryside, is delicious when eaten with a soft, savory siraegi on rice, and when you eat a cool soup, the feeling of ribs disappears. It is enough to eat 2 servings of 3 people because it is 200g to the bones per serving.
Steamed spicy ribs served as a service on Korean beef ribs
Business Hours 10: 00 ~ 22: 00, Open year round, Korean beef seasoned ribs 200g 22,000 won.
Siraegi miso soup that blows the feeling
Seonjigukbap with a yukgaejang visual with plenty of beef and green onions
Okya Restaurant, located in Anjak Alley, in Andong New Market, is a restaurant that has been boiling Seonjiguk Rice for 50 years. Until it is highly praised by the national rice enthusiasts as the best soup in the country, the broth of Okya Restaurant is boiled constantly, with plenty of Andong Hanwoo's noodles such as Yangji, Satae, and Seonji. The visual is rich in beef, spicy red pepper oil, sweet radish, and green onions, but it's a simple name, Seonjigukbap. The trade name “Andong Siyeonghalmae Sunjik Gukbap” used the sign of a municipal butcher operated by Okya Restaurant. As I was at a meat store, I was able to boil soup with a lot of delicious meat.
Seonji Gukbap
Add a pot full of Andong Korean beef bones and meat, and simmer the cabbage, green onion, and sesame seeds in savory broth. The shop, which started with one square, continues to expand to the side, but the waiting time becomes longer in winter. The shabby interior where the traces of the old buildings remain are in harmony with the taste of a bowl of soup. Adding soup, meat and rice is unlimited. A combination of illusion that makes the bowl of soup cooked every day, sour mixed, and red bean paste pickled in a bowl.
Put the brisket, landslide, and green onion in a cauldron and simmer.
Business hours 08: 00 ~ 20: 00, closed on the day of the holiday, Seonjigukbap 8,000 won.
A delicious table topped with sweet and sour mix and red pepper paste
Andong Geonjin Noodles cooked by a grandmother with red sesame seeds
Rumors are good, but the most difficult food to eat is Andong Geonjin Noodles. In Andong city, there are several noodle shops that serve dried noodles, but if you go to 'Park Jae-sook Farmer's House' on the way to Hahoe Village, you can taste the dried noodles. In a traditional way, the dough mixed with flour and soy flour is pushed with red sesame seeds, boiled in boiling water, dried, and then dried. Konjin noodles are perfect for summer, but they are always a favorite for those who like noodles.
The owner puts anchovy, radish, onion, and kelp into the seaweed twice a week to boil the broth with care. The pumpkin, kimchi, grated flour, and sesame seeds are gently softened, and the soft noodles are soft. It feels plain, but the soup is so deep that it is impossible to give up the last melody.
Rustic country side dishes and dried noodles
Business hours 09: 00 ~ 18: 00, closed on national holidays, Konjin noodles 7,000 won.
Boil broth twice a week
Gyeongsang-do chueotang, boiled with fresh local food
'Gyeongsangdo Chueotang', located in the food street of Andong City, is hidden in an alley. A traditional kitchen in a restaurant that has been renovated. Boiled hot water is boiled for 24 hours in a traditional cauldron on an old buttock. The two are running together, but the pride in Gyeongsangdo Chueotang is great. Uiseong garlic, nutritious red pepper powder, and green cabbage grown in Andong are boiled with natural loach, so it is delicious. The loach is boiled in a cauldron, crushed in a colander to filter out the bones and intestines, and then put plenty of green cabbage to preserve the sweetness.
Gyeongsangdo-style chueotang with a cool taste like clear miso soup
Chueotang is a refreshing and refreshing but richly rich protein, calcium, and mineral like a cabbage soup boiled with a little miso. People in Gyeongsang-do eat herbs with scented herbs such as zephyr and scented leaves in a chueotang that tastes better when the cold wind starts to blow. On a day when there are many customers packing, chueotang may drop. Phone check required in the evening.
Chueotang boiling in a cauldron
Business hours 10: 00 ~ 20: 30, closed on holidays, Chuotang costs 8,000 won.
Sweet and soft chueotang with green cabbage
Udon noodles with light and plain memories
'Shinseon Sikdang', which continues the tradition with only one udon in one place, is a restaurant lined up in summer. Cold noodle and bibimbap, jajangmyeon and udon, loved by all seasons, steadily gather noodle enthusiasts. Cold udon, the best menu of Sinseon Restaurant, has a cool taste that is loved by the morning sun.
A cool cold udon loved by the four seasons
The first taste of the cold udon noodles that rolls the thick wheat noodles in anchovy broth boiled in a clear and light taste is boring. This is thanks to the broth that boils with anchovies that have been airborne in Yeosu for 34 years. However, the more you eat, the cooler the soup will be, so you will continue to eat it. The only garnishes are Danmu Jichae, Cucumber, and Kim powder. Bibim Udon, with cabbage and red pepper paste added, also has a nice, unpretentious taste. Even regulars who have visited Shinseon Restaurant for more than 30 years can't forget the neat taste of noodles.
Jjajang Udon made with only vegetables
Business hours 07: 00 ~ 20: 00, closed irregularly (phone check required), cold udon ubibibi udon 4,000 won each.
Bibim Udon with a spicy sauce that goes well with the hot noodles
